and then I go in with the what air Pooler is a a website that allows pilots to sell the empty seats on their

there's a problem that it's directly rooted to once I've really explained the why and what that's when you want to get

that you end up with a lot more emotional resonance so uh so for us instance like take Jack dorsy and how he
built Square he like you go in and ask Jack dorsy he was like what does Square do how does it do it but I think the
much more interesting question is why did you build it in the first place and he did a talk at Tech runch disrupt and he talked a little bit about this he
described that when he was a kid he grew up in his dad's pizza restaurant and he saw his dad getting frustrated that the
credit card companies were demanding these high fees from him and it was a complicated process and you know more
and more people wanted to pay with credit but he felt his dad felt like he was losing part of his this you know the
the money that he was rightfully earning to these credit card companies that weren't really providing much utility they weren't making it especially easy
for him or his customers and they were just sort of like taxing him for for what was becoming a really important and
essential functionality for any any piece of Commerce and so what did he do he built something that you know cut a
lot of that uh like that credit card transaction process out of the flow and he made it really easy for any Merchant
to offer credit card payments uh in a really simple way that was always affordable for them even if somebody
bought something for really cheap like a single slice of pizza you know when you buy a single slice of pizza suddenly
that 25 cents or that 50 Cent um credit card fee adds up really quickly and he
wanted to build something that would work for any size Merchant uh because he saw that pain in his father and so we ended up building something that with a
flat percentage rate which works even for small Merchants square is great so that's that's that's the first thing I
usually ask people uh when I want to learn about why they built something or you know for for a lot of you guys if
